Working with the History List

When you select an item from the upper pane and click the History tab, it displays historical information about that item in the History list.

Default columns on the History list are:

  • View: View to which the file belongs.

  • Revision: Number StarTeam assigned to the revision when it was checked in.

  • Author: Person who checked in the revision.

  • Time: Date and time of the revision.

  • Comment: Reason for creating the revision.

  • Branch Revision: Special form of the revision number that indicates the branch path for this revision.

Using the History Context Menu

The History context menu appears when you highlight an item on the History list and right-click. This menu allows you to perform a variety of operations on the selected item. Certain options appear only for files.

Options on the History context menu include:

Check Out (files only)

Immediately check out the selected revision to the working folder.

Check Out To (files only)

Check out the selected revision to a location of your choice.

Properties

Display the properties of the selected revision.

Compare Properties

Compare properties of any two revisions of an item. If you select two items, their properties are compared side-by-side in a dialog box. If you select only one item, its properties are compared with the tip revision.

Compare Contents (files only)

Compare the contents of two file revisions using Visual Diff. If you select only one file revision, that revision's content is compared with the tip revision.

View Revision Content (files only)

Copy the revision to a temporary file and display its content in the default editor.

Open Revision Content (files only)

Copy the revision to a temporary file and display its content in the appropriate application.

References

Display the references for the selected revision.

Edit Comment...

Change the comment currently associated with the selected revision.
